question_sentence: All 80 people on board survived after a Delta Air Lines plane flipped over after landing in which city?
evidence: The Bombardier CRJ-900 passenger jet flipped upside-down as it touched down at Pearson International Airport at the end of a flight from Minneapolis, shearing off its tail and one of its wings. Remarkably, all passengers and crew evacuated safely, although 18 people were injured, three of them seriously.

question_sentence: An Egyptian-British archaeological mission has found the tomb of which pharaoh?
evidence: An Egyptian-British mission has found the tomb of King Thutmose II, the last undiscovered royal tomb of Egypt's 18th dynasty, and the first pharaoh's burial chamber found since Tutankhamun in 1922. Though his tomb was empty, archaeologists plan to continue the search for his second tomb.

question_sentence: Which party is leading in the polls ahead of Germany's election on Sunday?
evidence: The run-up to Germany's 2025 election has been an unusually fractious affair, fuelled by the rise of the far-right and a fraught debate over migration policy. In the last televised party leaders' debate this week, CDU candidate and likely next chancellor Friedrich Merz also traded verbal blows with the AfD's Alice Weidel over Germany's support for Ukraine.

question_sentence: How did the White House announce President Trump's order to rescind New York City's congestion charge?
evidence: After the Trump administration rescinded federal approval for New York's congestion pricing toll programme, the president declared on social media, "CONGESTION PRICING IS DEAD," and "Manhattan, and all of New York, is SAVED. LONG LIVE THE KING!" The Metropolitan Transportation Authority, which manages the new scheme, quickly filed a lawsuit and said it would keep collecting the $9 toll until a court told it otherwise.

question_sentence: The Welsh government is considering plans to make it illegal for its politicians to do what?
evidence: The Welsh Senedd is considering a world-first law to bar politicians from office if they are "found guilty of deliberate lying". Adam Price of Plaid Cymru, who introduced the proposal, said it would help "restore and rebuild and maintain" voters' fractured faith in democracy.

question_sentence: In which city did a water main rupture during below-freezing temperatures, trapping cars in ice?
evidence: A 54-inch transmission line built in the 1930s ruptured and flooded the streets. City crews used inflatable boats to navigate the water and rescue 200 people. However, the water started to freeze as temperatures dropped, trapping cars in ice.

question_sentence: What is the much-derided slogan for New Zealand's latest tourist ad campaign?
evidence: The new slogan, unveiled by Prime Minister Christopher Luxon on Sunday, was met with widespread confusion and ridicule. The opposition Labour Party's tourism spokesperson said the phrase "makes New Zealand sound like we're in a clearance bin at a sale". Find out more on this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped.

question_sentence: Which film has dethroned "Inside Out 2" as the highest grossing animated movie?
evidence: The Chinese animated blockbuster has beaten Pixar's "Inside Out 2" and amassed $1.6 billion at the box office, making it the eighth highest-earning movie of any genre globally. It is also the first non-Hollywood film to break into the all-time global top 20 of highest-grossing films.

question_sentence: Which UK soap hit a milestone anniversary?
evidence: The residents of Albert Square have been a staple of BBC weeknights since 1985, and this month's 40th anniversary celebrations included a rare live episode. However, TV soaps' viewing figures are becoming as bleak as their storylines, raising concerns about the future of the genre in the streaming era.

question_sentence: Microsoft's new quantum computer chip is currently powered by how many "qubits"?
evidence: Microsoft's new chip for its Majorana 1 computer paves the way for more powerful quantum computers. The company has created eight "topological" qubits, but wants to fit a million qubits on to each chip, which could “deliver transformative, real-world solutions" like self-healing building materials and breaking down microplastics.

question_sentence: A Delta Air Lines flight this week crashed and overturned while landing, injuring at least 21 people. Where did the incident occur?
evidence: Investigators are working to determine what caused a Delta Air Lines flight to crash and roll over on the runway at Toronto Pearson International Airport on Monday. All 80 people on board survived, officials said.

question_sentence: Which controversial political figure will President Donald Trump “probably” meet with this month?
choices: North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un
evidence: As the US and Russia work to reestablish diplomatic channels and end the war in Ukraine, President Trump announced he will "probably" meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin before the end of the month.

question_sentence: Which state is investigating a measles outbreak involving at least 58 positive cases?
evidence: At least 58 measles cases were reported in an outbreak in West Texas, including some people who said they were vaccinated.

question_sentence: What is the name of the erupting volcano in Italy that drew thousands of tourists this week?
evidence: Spectacular lava sprays on Sicily's snowy Mount Etna, one of the world's most active volcanoes, are attracting scores of travelers.

question_sentence: Pope Francis was recently hospitalized for what type of infection?
evidence: The Vatican said Pope Francis is resting and recovering after the 88-year-old pontiff was diagnosed with pneumonia in both lungs.

question_sentence: Which US holiday takes place on the third Monday of February every year?
evidence: Many Americans this week enjoyed a day off for Presidents Day, officially named Washington’s Birthday in honor of America’s first president, George Washington (though his actual birthday is February 22).

question_sentence: Contaminated food is causing a growing number of illnesses in the US. Around how many food recalls were there in 2024?
evidence: A new report reveals there were about 300 food recalls in the US last year, associated with nearly 1,400 illnesses.

question_sentence: Around what percentage of US adults identify as LGBTQ+?
evidence: The proportion of American adults who identify as LGBTQ+ has risen to 9.3% of the population — a figure that has nearly doubled since 2020, according to a new Gallup Poll.

question_sentence: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum recently threatened to sue which American tech company?
evidence: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum threatened to sue Google over the switch from the "Gulf of Mexico" to the "Gulf of America," saying the tech company overstepped when it changed the name of the entire body of water on Google Maps.

question_sentence: Which singer is set to host the Tony Awards this year?
evidence: Cynthia Erivo, who is up for an Oscar for her performance in the film “Wicked,” will host this year's Tony Awards on June 8.
